Overview.Summary: In the 2023 Slovak parliamentary election, Peter Pellegrini was elected as president (2). As the leader of the HLAS party, he expressed his candidacy in a televised debate (6). The election was held on April 6, 2024 (2). Prior to the election, Slovakia's president urged lawmakers to reconsider plans to scrap a special prosecution office for high crimes and lower sentences for financial crimes (1). The country is also known for its sports aerobics competition, the Slovak Aerobic Open, held annually since 2000 (4). Slovakia is a landlocked country in Central Europe, bordered by Austria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, and Ukraine (5).

Slovakia's president urges lawmakers to reconsider criminal law reform.
Slovakia prepares for the second round of the presidential election, which could potentially shift the country's political stance.

The 25th edition of the Slovak Aerobic Open takes place in Bratislava.
Peter Pellegrini is officially declared the winner of the 2024 Slovak presidential election.
24 Interesting Facts About Slovakia are published, providing information about the country's population, languages, and religions.

Overview.Summary: The 2023 Slovak parliamentary election will take place in February 2024 (1,3). The president of Hungary was elected in July 2024 (2). Pakistan's military remains a power broker ahead of the 2024 election (4). French President Emmanuel Macron launched a political reset in January 2023 (5). Over 60 countries will hold elections in 2024, including the United States, Portugal, Austria, and Britain (6). Party donation and loan returns for the 2023 calendar year were due by April 2024 (7). Some pundits predicted that President Joe Biden will face a serious primary challenger in 2023 (8). Bangladesh's prime minister was re-elected in a parliamentary election in January 2024 (9). The next UK general election is expected to take place by January 2025 (10).

Timeline.Text: Ten candidates qualify for the ballot in the Slovak presidential election.
The Iraqi High Electoral Commission (IHEC) announces that the Kurdistan parliamentary election, previously scheduled for February 25, will be postponed due to financial concerns.
Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina wins a majority in the parliamentary elections, securing her fourth consecutive term.
French President Emmanuel Macron announces a change in Prime Minister in a bid to reset his party's political strategy.
A new president is elected in Hungary after the previous president resigned in 2023.
Pundits predict that US President Joe Biden will face a serious primary challenger in the upcoming election.
Political parties in New Zealand file their donation and loan returns for the 2023 calendar year.
Over 60 countries, including the United States and Britain, are set to hold elections in 2024.
Political analysts predict that the next general election in the UK will be held by January 28, 2025.
Pakistan's military remains a powerful force in the country's politics as the next general election approaches.

Timeline.Text: Togo postpones legislative elections due to contentious constitutional reform.
Slovakia's president urges lawmakers to reconsider criminal law reform, causing tens of thousands to protest.
Several candidates qualify for Slovak presidential election, including the leader of the far-right People's Party Our Slovakia.
The Maldives postpones parliamentary election due to the Ramadan month.
The Hungarian Alliance party splits into two factions.
Iran holds parliamentary elections with reports of low turnout.
The Socialist Party leads in Portugal's general election voting intention.
Slovak PM Fico's ally is in a tight presidential runoff with a pro-West challenger.
Pro-Russia candidate Peter Pellegrini is elected Slovakia's president.
Togo's legislative elections are postponed again due to a controversial constitutional reform.
Maldives' parliamentary election takes place with 368 candidates vying for 93 seats.
India embarks on the world's largest electoral exercise with the upcoming Lok Sabha election.
Belgium prepares for simultaneous federal, regional, and European elections.
Slovakia's parliament passes a new law that replaces its public broadcaster with a new framework.
The second phase of India's Lok Sabha election sees a boycott by voters in four villages.
